comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Information from Cambridge St Benedicts War Memorial The memorial is in place on the far wall of the church opposite the entrance. To the honoured memory of Martin Allan Anderson M.C. Major, 211, Field Company, Royal Engineers. Born 10th November 1887. Died of wounds received in action at Duisans near Arras Wednesday 9th May 1917. Age 29. Awarded the Military Cross. Son of James Drummond Anderson and Frances Louisa Anderson, of Greycotes, Cavendish Avenue, Cambridge. Buried in Duisans British Cemetery, Etrun, Pas de Calais, France. Grave III. M. 15.e door. www.roll-of-honour.com/Cambridgeshire/CambridgeStBenets.html A photo of the memorial can be seen at www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=pv&GRid=560733...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
Martin Alan Anderson appears as one of the CORPS OF ROYAL ENGINEERS Gentlemen Cadets from the
Royal Military Academy, to be Second Lieutenants. Dated 29th July, 1908 THE LONDON GAZETTE August 25,1908
